data.title: THE LIFE OF WILLIAM EWART GLADSTONE
data.meta_description: London: Macmillan, 1903 . A standard biography of the controversial four-time Prime Minister, written by his close friend, the Viscount Morley of Blackburn.  No English statesman has been more fervently adored or more intensely hated than Gladstone. DNB This is a very sturdy and attractively-bound set in excellent condition. data.text:
(London: Macmillan, 1903).

A standard biography of the controversial four-time Prime Minister, written by his close friend, the Viscount Morley of Blackburn. No English statesman has been more fervently adored or more intensely hated than Gladstone. [DNB]

This is a very sturdy and attractively-bound set in excellent condition. Item #32945

3 volumes. First edition. With 9 illustrations. 8vo, publisher's original sepia-red polished cloth, the spines ruled and lettered in gilt, the covers blocked in blind xi, 661; vii, 666; ix, 648 pp. A fine, handsome and attractive set, very well preserved indeed.
